title: Live Updates: Labour Party Wins U.K. Election in a Landslide
content: Keir Starmer will be Britain’s next prime minister, ending 14 years of Conservative government. A fragmented vote saw the Conservatives crash to the worst result in their long history.
summary: Keir Starmer will be Britain’s next prime minister, ending 14 years of Conservative government. A fragmented vote saw the Conservatives crash to the worst result in their long history.

title: This English Naval City Is a Bellwether Seat. How Do Voters Feel?
content: As voters cast their ballots in a pivotal election, many in the southern English city of Portsmouth expressed disillusionment over what they see as national and local decline.
summary: As voters cast their ballots in a pivotal election, many in the southern English city of Portsmouth expressed disillusionment over what they see as national and local decline.

title: Hurricane Beryl Bears Down on the Yucatán Peninsula
content: The storm, now a Category 2,  has lost some power since slamming Jamaica and Grenada this week. A hurricane warning is in effect for the coast of the Yucatán Peninsula.
summary: The storm, now a Category 2,  has lost some power since slamming Jamaica and Grenada this week. A hurricane warning is in effect for the coast of the Yucatán Peninsula.

title: Iran Voters Face Stark Choice in Competitive Presidential Runoff
content: For the first time in years, the outcome is difficult to predict, and could be decided by how many people end their boycotts and participate in the vote.
summary: For the first time in years, the outcome is difficult to predict, and could be decided by how many people end their boycotts and participate in the vote.

title: Iran’s Presidential Candidates: Who Are They?
content: Two candidates face off in Iran’s runoff election on Friday after neither secured enough votes to win in the first round. Here’s what you need to know about their positions and background.
summary: Two candidates face off in Iran’s runoff election on Friday after neither secured enough votes to win in the first round. Here’s what you need to know about their positions and background.

title: Hungary’s Viktor Orban Travels to Russia for Meeting With Vladimir Putin
content: Days after a trip to Ukraine, the Hungarian leader arrived in Moscow for a visit that has dismayed E.U. officials, who have made clear that he is not there on behalf of the bloc.
summary: Days after a trip to Ukraine, the Hungarian leader arrived in Moscow for a visit that has dismayed E.U. officials, who have made clear that he is not there on behalf of the bloc.

title: Justice Department Opens Criminal Investigation in Chinese Doping Case
content: The move escalates a fight with China and world antidoping officials, and will cast a shadow over the Paris Olympics.
summary: The move escalates a fight with China and world antidoping officials, and will cast a shadow over the Paris Olympics.

title: Why More French Youth Are Voting for the Far Right
content: Most young people in France usually don’t vote or they back the left. That is still true, but support has surged for the far right, whose openly racist past can feel to them like ancient history.
summary: Most young people in France usually don’t vote or they back the left. That is still true, but support has surged for the far right, whose openly racist past can feel to them like ancient history.

title: Israeli Leaders to Discuss Hamas Response on Cease-Fire Proposal
content: A senior White House official called progress in talks with Hamas “a breakthrough,” while Israel was more restrained, and both said major obstacles to a truce remained.
summary: A senior White House official called progress in talks with Hamas “a breakthrough,” while Israel was more restrained, and both said major obstacles to a truce remained.

title: Greece’s Six-Day Workweek: What to Know
content: The country, which already has the European Union’s longest average workweek, wants to add another day in some cases, bucking a growing business trend.
summary: The country, which already has the European Union’s longest average workweek, wants to add another day in some cases, bucking a growing business trend.

title: First African-Born Member of German Parliament Won’t Seek Re-election
content: Karamba Diaby, whose 2013 victory was considered a win for equality, said he wanted more time with his family. But he has also spoken of the death threats he has received.
summary: Karamba Diaby, whose 2013 victory was considered a win for equality, said he wanted more time with his family. But he has also spoken of the death threats he has received.

title: Saudi Arabia Sentences Producer to 13 Years in Prison Over Netflix Show

title: Cristiano Ronaldo, Euro 2024 and the Problem With Too Much Fame
